data.title: 10 Must See Things in Washington County
data.meta_description: Washington County, PA is full of so many fun things to do and see. Whether it's an indoor attraction, historic landmark, a piece of nature, or a roadside oddity there is always something to keep you entertained in Washington County.
data.text:
One of the most important and well-known people to come out of Washington County, PA is singer, Perry Como.

Born in Canonsburg, PA in 1912, Perry Como was a well-known Italian-American singer, songwriter, actor, and television personality.

To honor Perry Como, the town of Canonsburg pays tribute to his legacy by playing his music 24/7 where his statue is located outside of the Canonsburg Municipal Building.

Whether you are a music fan or not, this is one roadside oddity you do not want to miss.

You don’t have to go to Kansas to see this Wizard of Oz art display, located at the office and home of Loretta Kendall in McDonald, PA.

This piece of public art was created from leftover parts from their family farm by Kendall’s late father, and has since been a staple of the McDonald Community for years. This quirky art piece brings people from both near and far to see this marvelous art piece and take photos with it.

The next time you are in search of a fun place to take photos, check out the Wizard of Oz art piece in McDonald!

You can take a trip back in time to when trolley cars heavily occupied the streets when visiting the Pennsylvania Trolley Museum in Washington, PA.

Experience the county from a new perspective while learning about the history of trollies at this must see destination.

If you are looking for a fun way to take a trip back into a different era, then check out the Trolley Museum.

A new historical landmark to Washington County, PA is the Coal Miners Memorial located at Cecil Park, PA.

This interesting historical dedication commemorates those miners who have lost their lives in one of the numerous coal mines that operated in Cecil Township, PA over the past century.

The Coal Miners Memorial honors those fallen coal miners while also taking in the beautiful scenery of Cecil Park.

If you are interested in the history of Washington County, PA then you must check out the Coal Miners Memorial.

For those who are interested in experiencing more of an exciting and fast paced form of entertainment watching a Washington Wild Things baseball game is a must.

Founded in 2001, the Washington Wild Things, a professional baseball team in the Frontier League, have been bringing the excitement of baseball to its Washington County Community and fans alike.

While watching a Washington Wild Things game fans are met with family oriented games and activities throughout the entire ballpark. At the center of the stadium, a large playground is present allowing for the kiddos to blow off some of their “cotton candy induced energy.”

Many baseball enthusiasts enjoy this park for its affordable prices, constant entertainment, great food, and great baseball team of course.

The next time you are in Washington County during baseball season, check out a Washington Wild Things game.

When visiting Washington County, PA one thing the locals are all sure to tell you that you must see is a horse race at the Hollywood Casino at The Meadows located in the Meadowlands, PA.

Enjoy watching elegant horses compete in standardbred harness racing from the outdoor stands with the whole family or make it a date night and watch from inside the casino in one of the clubhouse rooms.

Whether you are there to watch for entertainment or to test your luck at betting on the horse races, visiting the racetrack at Hollywood Casino at The Meadows is a must when in Washington County, PA.

Calling all history buffs! Take a trip back to what it was like to be a prehistoric American when you visit Meadowcroft Rockshelter & Historic Village in Avella, PA.

This historic village allows for you to experience over 19,000 years of history in one day through its many exhibits including its Meadowcroft Historic Village, Prehistoric Indian Village, and Frontier Trading Post exhibit just to name a few.

If you are looking for a fun way to take a trip back in time, then Meadowcroft Rockshelter & Historic Village in Avella, PA is a must see.

Another must see attraction in Washington County that will surely satisfy your sweet tooth is Sarris Candies in Canonsburg, PA.

Sarris Candies is a well-known around the world chocolate factory that has been in operation since the 1960’s. This candy factory produces specialty chocolate and candies that are enjoyed by millions of people around the world.

When first entering the doors of Sarris you are greeted by a bright red “Willy Wonka” atmosphere complete with a large ice cream parlor filled with an abundance of Sarris’s homemade ice cream. Head on over to the candy shop to fill up on your favorite candy or check out the massive candy castle made entirely of Sarris Candies chocolate.

If you are looking to channel your inner child while satisfying your sweet tooth, then check out Sarris Candies in Canonsburg, PA.

The Little Lake Theater in McMurray, PA has been providing its guests with quality theater entertainment since the early 1940’s.

Watch your favorite play or musical performance in the original barn style theater with the whole family. Enjoy a bite to eat or a cold beverage at The Little Lake Theater’s kitchen area and bar while watching your favorite show.

No matter what show you choose to watch, you are sure to be entertained at The Little Lake Theater in McMurray, PA.
